title: Three reasons why a level playing field with the EU is the last thing we need
text:
Workers will be stripped of their rights. We will be flooded with chlorinated chicken. Safety standards will be ripped up, we will be dominated by American technology giants and turned into an offshore gangster economy unfairly undercutting all our rivals.

Once we finally get around to negotiating our relationship with the European Union after we have left, it is likely to demand regulatory convergence with a post-Brexit UK to avoid all that and to ensure a “level playing field”.

In this country lots of people, including big businesses, will argue we will have to give into that if it secures open access to the European market. But hold on? Why would we want a level playing field with our biggest...
